other_tests.findings: On admission, blood glucose level was 39 mg per deciliter (2.2 mmol per liter); 30 minutes later, it was 13 mg per deciliter (<0.6 mmol per liter); after feeding, it increased to 73 mg per deciliter (41 mmol per liter).
other_tests.changes_over_time: Blood glucose decreased significantly during fasting and increased after feeding.

other_tests.findings: Elevated to 0.44 mmol per liter (reference range, 0.08 to 0.16).
Measured at 6.0 μIU per milliliter (reference range, 2.6 to 25.0), noted to be hemolyzed.
other_tests.changes_over_time: A repeat measurement during a subsequent hypoglycemic episode showed insulin less than 0.2 μIU per milliliter.

other_tests.findings: Low at 0.7 ng per milliliter (reference range, 1.1 to 4.4).
Clear, colorless urine with specific gravity of 1.005 and pH of 6.0; ketones were absent.
Confirmed diagnosis of glycogen storage disease type I with mutations in the G6PC gene.
